Row.Text: The Monument increases the [ICON_CULTURE] Culture of a city, speeding the growth of the city's territory and the civilization's acquisition of Social Policies and improving relations with other highly cultured civilizations.
+1 [ICON_GOLD] from every resource worked by this city. Increases the likelihood that a Merchant will appear.
+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Research for every 2 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in this City. Increases the likelihood that a Sage will appear.
+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from Grapes, Dye, Silk and Spices worked by this city. Increases the likelihood that an Artist will appear.
Increases the likelihood that an Artist will appear.
+10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards Melee Units. +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Copper, Iron and Mithril. Increases the likelihood that an Engineer will appear.
+10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards Buildings and Siege units. +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Blasting Powder. Increases the likelihood that an Engineer will appear.

Increases the likelihood that a Devout will appear.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May only be built if you have opened either the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Pantheism[ENDCOLOR] or [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Theism[ENDCOLOR] Policy Branch.

+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food from [ICON_RES_DEER] Deer, [ICON_RES_TRUFFLES] Boars, [ICON_RES_FUR] Small Game and [ICON_RES_IVORY] Elephants worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Each camp-improved resource owned by this city that is remote (>3 plots from city) provides +1 Food [ICON_FOOD] through this building.

+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +1 Leather resource from Boars, Cows, Deer and Horses worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have an improved source of at least one of these resources nearby:
+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +1 Ivory resource from Elephants and Whales resources worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have an improved source of at least one of these resources nearby:
10% of [ICON_FOOD] Food is carried over after growth.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_FOOD] Food from Wheat worked by this city.

10% of [ICON_FOOD] Food is carried over after growth.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from Salt resources worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have an improved source of Salt nearby.

+30% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards horse-mounted units.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Horses resources worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have an improved source of Horses nearby.

+20% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards elephant-mounted units.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Elephants resources worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have an improved source of Elephants nearby.

+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from [ICON_RES_DEER] Deer, [ICON_RES_TRUFFLES] Boars, [ICON_RES_FUR] Small Game and [ICON_RES_IVORY] Elephants worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Each camp-improved resource owned by this city that is remote (>3 plots from city) provides +1 Food [ICON_FOOD] and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold through this building.
+2 [ICON_FOOD] Food from Cows, Horse and Sheep resources worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have an improved source of at least one of these resources nearby.
+2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] PRODUCTION from Cows, Horse and Sheep worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have an improved source of at least one of these resources nearby.

Allows the city to form [ICON_CONNECTED] Trade Routes across water.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food from [ICON_RES_FISH] Fish, [ICON_RES_CRAB] Crabs, [ICON_RES_PEARLS] Oysters and [ICON_RES_WHALE] Whales worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Each sea resource owned by this city that is remote (>3 plots from city) provides +1 Food [ICON_FOOD] through this building.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must be coastal.
+1 Timber resource from Sawmills near this City.[NEWLINE]+1 Timber for every 4 unimproved Forest and Jungle tiles for Pantheistic Civilizations.
+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from Cotton worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have an improved source of Cotton nearby.
+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from Wine worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have an improved source of Wine nearby.
Provides 1 Ale resource; +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from Wheat worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have an improved source of Wheat nearby.
+2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Research from Reagents resources worked by this city.[NEWLINE]+2 Health in this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have an improved source of Reagents nearby.

+2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from Gold, Silver and Mithril and +1 [ICON_GOLD] from Copper and Iron resources worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have an improved source of at least one of these resources nearby.
+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +2 [ICON_CULTURE] from Stone and Marble worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have an improved source of at least one of these resources nearby.
May only be built if you have taken the Pantheism Social Policy.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May only be built by the SÃ­dhe.
Reduces extra [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness in an [ICON_OCCUPIED] Occupied City by 10%.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May only be built if you have taken the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Slavery[ENDCOLOR] Social Policy.
Can convert 1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen per turn into a Slaves unit.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May only be built if you have taken the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Debt Bondage[ENDCOLOR] Social Policy.

Reduces extra [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from an [ICON_OCCUPIED] Occupied City by 40%.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May only be built if you have taken the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Militarism[ENDCOLOR] Social Policy.
May only be built in a City of a different race than your Civilization and if you have taken the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tradition[ENDCOLOR] Social Policy.

Eliminates extra [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from an [ICON_OCCUPIED] Occupied City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May only be built 100 turns after conquest, in a City of the same race as your Civilization and if you have taken the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tradition[ENDCOLOR] Social Policy.
+20% [ICON_CONNECTED] Trade in this City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must be built on the coast.
City must be built next to a River.
City must have at least 5 flat adjacent plots.

On completion, improves a Lake plot with the Floating Gardens improvement, giving +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Can be built repeatedly as long as there is an unimproved Lake plot in this city's borders.
Reduces extra [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from an [ICON_OCCUPIED] Occupied City by 30%.
Walls increase a city's Defense Strength, making the city more difficult to capture. Walls are quite useful for cities located along a civilization's frontier.

Increases the likelihood that a Merchant will appear.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+15% [ICON_GOLD] Gold with the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mercantilism[ENDCOLOR] Social Policy.

+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from each [ICON_RES_FISH] Fish, [ICON_RES_CRAB] Crabs, [ICON_RES_PEARLS] Oysters and [ICON_RES_WHALE] Whales worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Each sea resource owned by this city that is remote (>3 plots from city) provides +1 Food [ICON_FOOD] and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold through this building.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must be coastal and have a Harbor.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+15% [ICON_GOLD] Gold with the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Merchant Navy[ENDCOLOR] Social Policy.
Increases the likelihood that a Sage will appear.

Increases the likelihood that an Artist will appear.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have an Amphitheater.
Increases the likelihood that an Artist will appear.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have an Amphitheater.
+1 [ICON_CULTURE] from Wine and Incense resources worked by this city. Increases the likelihood that a Devout will appear.

+20% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards Archery units and they receive +5 XP.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from Yew resources worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have an improved source of Yew nearby.
+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +1 Spirits resources from Sugar resources worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have an improved source of Yew nearby.

+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from [ICON_RES_WHALE] Whales worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Each Whale owned by this city that is remote (>3 plots from city) provides +1 Food [ICON_FOOD] and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production through this building.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must be coastal and have a Harbor.

+5% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards Melee units and they receive +5 XP.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Copper, Iron, Mithril and Blasting Powder resources worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have a Forge and an improved source of at least one of these resources nearby.

+5% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards Melee units and they receive +5 XP.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Copper, Iron, Mithril and Blasting Powder resources worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have an Armory and an improved source of at least one of these resources nearby.

+2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Research from Blasting Powder, Mithril and Reagents resources worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have a Library and an improved source of at least one of these resources nearby.
+2 [ICON_GOLD] GOld and +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from Sheep, Cotton, Silk and Dye resources worked by this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City an improved source of at least one of these resources nearby.
Enables you to sell Slaves for [ICON_GOLD] Gold.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May only be built if you have taken the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Slave Trade[ENDCOLOR] Social Policy.
Has a small chance each turn of spawning a Slaves unit.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May only be built if you have taken the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Slave Raiders[ENDCOLOR] Social Policy.
Enables you to render Slaves for [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May only be built if you have taken the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Slave Castes[ENDCOLOR] Social Policy.

Halves the Growth Penalty when your empire is Unhappy and allows you to train Settlers regardless of unhappines.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May only be built if you have taken the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Slave Breeding[ENDCOLOR] Social Policy.
Nearby revolting units are eliminated or converted into Slaves.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May only be built if you have taken the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Servi Aeternam[ENDCOLOR] Social Policy.
+5 XP for all Land Units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May only be built if you have taken the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Discipline[ENDCOLOR] Social Policy.
+1 Jewelry resource. +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from Gold, Silver, Gems, Jade and Oysters resources worked by this city.
+1 Porcelain resource.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May only be built if you have taken the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Crafting[ENDCOLOR] Social Policy.

Must be built by a Devout.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May only be built if you have taken either the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Pantheism[ENDCOLOR] or [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Theism[ENDCOLOR] Social Policies.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mercenary[ENDCOLOR] City States excel in the training of one or more units (or unit lines) which are available for hire. Any civilization can hire mercenaries from these city states if they are friends or allies. Civilizations with the Mercenaries policy can hire these units regardless of friendship (so long as they are not at war) but receive a discount if friends (-10%) or allies (-20%). Theses city states will usually have some strategic resources available that are appropriate for their unit specialization. (Note: Unit specializations not implemented yet.)

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Slaver[ENDCOLOR] City States produce and capture slaves which can be purchased by civilizations that have opened the Slavery policy branch. These city states will occasionally declare war on their neighbors (either city state or full civ) but only when they see good opportunity for slave raiding. Being friends or allies reduces the cost of slaves and reduces, but does not eliminate, the chance of being raided for slaves (previous good relationship will be re-established after cessation of the slave raid) (Slavers CS trait not yet implemented!)

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Arcane[ENDCOLOR] City States are potential sources of [ICON_STAR] Mana for your civilization and arcane spells for your thaumaturges. These effects are not available to civilizations that follow Azzandarayasna. Friends and allies gain 4 and 8 [ICON_STAR] Mana per turn, respectively. Each magical city state has one unique arcane spell that will be learned by any visiting thaumaturge from an allied civilization (not yet implemented). An Arcane city state that has been converted to Azzandarayasna will no longer provide these benefits.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Holy[ENDCOLOR] City States are a potential source of [ICON_PEACE] Divine Favor for your civilization and divine spells for your devouts. These effects are only available to civilizations that follow Azzandarayasna. Friends and allies gain 4 and 8 [ICON_PEACE] Divine Favor per turn, respectively. Each holy city state has one unique divine spell that will be learned by any visiting devout from an allied civilization (not yet implemented). These city states will slowly accumulate Azzandarayasna followers after that religion has been founded, eventually converting on their own. A Holy city state that has been converted to The Weave of Ãa or any of its cults will no longer provide these effects. A Holy city state that has been converted to AÅra becomes Unholy, providing benefits (mana and altered divine spells) only to fallen civilizations.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Unholy[ENDCOLOR] City States were once Holy City States that have Fallen. They are potential sources of [ICON_STAR] Mana but only for Fallen civilization. Fallen civilizations that are Friends or allies gain 4 or 8 [ICON_STAR] Mana per turn, respectively. An Unholy City State converted to Azzandarayasna returns to its original Holy status.
(Spheres are not yet implemented!)
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Industrial Agriculture[ENDCOLOR] converts 25% of the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into food distributed in all cities.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]World Weave[ENDCOLOR] uses [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City to convert citizens worldwide into followers of The Weave of Ãa (randomly converted from cities that already have at least one follower, with pantheistic cult followers considered followers of The Weave; 100 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production needed to convert one non-religious citizen, 500 to convert a theistic citizen).

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Ãa Blessings[ENDCOLOR] converts 10% of the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into Living Terrain strength, randomly applied to non-improved forest, jungle or marsh plots worldwide.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Major Spirits' Tribute[ENDCOLOR] converts 25% of the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence divided among all Major Spirits of Ãa that are friends or allies, or all contacted if none are currently friends or allies.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Faeries' Tribute[ENDCOLOR] converts [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into boosted relationship with The Fay (boost equals moving average of production contributed over the last 100 turns divided by 10).
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Azzandara's Tribute[ENDCOLOR] converts 25% of the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into [ICON_PEACE] Divine Favor.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]World Salvation[ENDCOLOR] uses [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City to convert citizens worldwide into followers of Azzandarayasna (randomly converted from cities that already have at least one follower; 100 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production needed to convert one non-religious citizen, 500 to convert a citizen of another religion).

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Ahriman's Tribute[ENDCOLOR] converts 25% of the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into consumed [ICON_STAR] Mana. The Mana is directly consumed and never made available to the civilization.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]World Corruption[ENDCOLOR] uses [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City to convert citizens worldwide into followers of AÅra (randomly converted from cities that already have at least one follower; 100 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production needed to convert one non-religious citizen, 500 to convert a citizen of another religion).
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Oppression[ENDCOLOR] converts 25% of the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into civilization [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Training Exercises[ENDCOLOR] converts 25% of the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into experience divided among all military units.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]The Arts[ENDCOLOR] converts 25% of the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Research[ENDCOLOR] converts 25% of the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into [ICON_RESEARCH] Research.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Trade Surplus[ENDCOLOR] converts 25% of the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into [ICON_GOLD] Gold.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Patronage[ENDCOLOR] converts 25% of the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence divided among all City State friends and allies, or all contacted if none are currently friends or allies.

Establishes Fishing Boats on [ICON_RES_FISH] Fish, [ICON_RES_CRAB] Crabs, [ICON_RES_PEARLS] Oysters and Lakes. Can establish on sea resources (not lakes) up to 5 plots from cities with Sailing, up to 7 plots with Ship Construction, or up to 9 plots with Navigation.

Establishes Whaling Boats on [ICON_RES_WHALE] Whales. Can establish up to 5 plots from cities with Sailing, up to 7 plots with Ship Construction, up to 9 plots with Navigation, or up to 11 plots with Whaling.

Establishes Camps on [ICON_RES_DEER] Deer, [ICON_RES_TRUFFLES] Boars, [ICON_RES_FUR] Small Game and [ICON_RES_IVORY] Elephants. Can establish up to 5 plots from cities with Tracking, or up to 7 plots with Animal Mastery.
Allows the caster to select a spell to learn.

Gives the caster a range 2 attack with strength equal to the caster's modifier.
Adds the Hex promotion to an adjacent enemy unit lowering strength by 20%.
Heals up to caster's modifier in HPs for one allied living unit on same or adjacent plot.
Increases the spread and regeneration strength of Living Terrain by the caster's modifier.
Adds the Bless promotion to one living unit giving +10 hp natural healing.
Adds Protection from Evil promotion to one living unit protecting from negative spell effects and giving +5 hp natural healing.
Damages adjacent enemy living unit up to the caster's modifier.
Adds the Cursed promotion to one enemy living unit preventing all natural healing.
Adds the Evil-Eye promotion to one enemy living unit preventing positive spell effects and giving -5 hp natural healing.
Creates a forest or jungle on any valid plot adjacent to an already existing forest or jungle.
Adds Ride Like the Wind promotion to all adjacent or same plot horse-mounted units adding +2 movement.
Removes all bad bad spell effects and provides some healing to one unit.
Permanently adds the Fair Winds promotion to one nearby allied ship adding +1 movement.
Adds civilization happiness equal to the caster's modifier.
